xeno.remoting.web

Class Browser

  • java.lang.Object
    • xeno.remoting.web.Browser

  • public class Browser
extends Object

    An object to locate the specific client for calling JavaScript functions. To call client side JavaScript success, you should provide session ID or page URI, these two items are following below rules:

    • Session ID - This is the same value of HttpSession.getId(), you could get your current session thread from MessageServlet.getCurrentHttpSessionThread() and then get the session ID.
    • Page URI - This is the value comes from the browser address bar, and start after your application context path. For an example, if current URL is "http://www.abc.com:8030/testapp/account/list#bookmark?p1=1&p2=a", and "testapp" is the context path of this application deployed, then the page URI will be "/account/list".
    Author:
    Kai Feng

    • Method Detail

      • with

        public static JavaScriptCallback with(String sessionId,
                      String pageUri)
                               throws IllegalArgumentException

        Returns the callback for the specific client by session ID and page URI provided.

        Parameters:
        sessionId - The session ID, cannot be null.
        pageUri - The page URI, cannot be null.
        Returns:
        The callback, never be null.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown when the "sessionId" or the "pageUri" is null.

      • withAll

        public static JavaScriptCallback withAll()

        Returns the callback for all clients.

        Returns:
        The callback, never be null.

      • withPage

        public static JavaScriptCallback withPage(String pageUri)
                                   throws IllegalArgumentException

        Returns the callback for specific clients by the page URI provided. All sessions matches this page URI will be invoked.

        Parameters:
        pageUri - The page URI, cannot be null.
        Returns:
        The callback, never be null.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown when the "pageUri" is null.

      • withPages

        public static JavaScriptCallback withPages(String... pageUris)
                                    throws IllegalArgumentException

        Returns the callback for specific clients by page URIs provided. All sessions matches these page URIs will be invoked.

        Parameters:
        pageUris - The page URIs, cannot be null. And all items in the array also cannot be null.
        Returns:
        The callback, never be null.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown when the "pageUris" is null. Or thrown when any item in the "pageUris" is null.

      • withPages

        public static JavaScriptCallback withPages(Collection<String> pageUris)
                                    throws IllegalArgumentException

        Please see withPages(String...) with the Collection type argument.

        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException

                                      throws IllegalArgumentException

        Throws:
